channel.title: Gmod setexpressionoverride
channel.description:
I've been trying out the console command "ent_fire setexpressionoverride" in Garry's Mod 13 recently and been having no luck.
I put the command in as follows: "ent_fire z1* setexpressionoverride scenes/citadel/br_youneedme.vcd" *My ent name after renaming it with "ent_setname"
I continuously get an error telling me that the scene cannot be found. Even when I change the scene to something different I get the same error for every scene.
I tried extracting the scene files from HL2's cache file and placing it in locations that matched up with where it was in the cache. I put the file in HL2's files and Gmod beta's.
Is there something I'm doing wrong or is there soemthing wrong with the game/files?

item.title: Gmod setexpressionoverride
item.dc:creator: Katana
item.description:
New source is stupid about VCDs because Xbox is stupid about small text files. Any VCD files moved into a new game directory must then be compiled as part of its “scenes.image” file. To do this, open up Source SDK for the game in question, then go to File > Rebuild Scenes.image. You may be able to move this file between some Source games.

Read full topic

item.title: Gmod setexpressionoverride
item.dc:creator: trevjamsey
item.description:
I’ve been trying out the console command “ent_fire setexpressionoverride” in Garry’s Mod 13 recently and been having no luck.

I put the command in as follows: “ent_fire z1* setexpressionoverride scenes/citadel/br_youneedme.vcd”
*My ent name after renaming it with “ent_setname”

I continuously get an error telling me that the scene cannot be found. Even when I change the scene to something different I get the same error for every scene.

I tried extracting the scene files from HL2’s cache file and placing it in locations that matched up with where it was in the cache. I put the file in HL2’s files and Gmod beta’s.

Is there something I’m doing wrong or is there soemthing wrong with the game/files?
